        public Dungeon(java.lang.String filename)
        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
               Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        Read from the .bork filename passed, and instantiate a Dungeon object based on it.
        Parameters:
        filename - Full bork file name including extension.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException

      • Dungeon

        public Dungeon(java.lang.String filename,
               boolean initState)
        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
               Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        Read from the .bork filename passed, and instantiate a Dungeon object based on it, including the items/NPCs in their original locations.
        Parameters:
        filename - Full bork file name including extension
        initState - Represents the desire to reload the map or restore
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException

    • Method Detail

      • add

        private void add(NPC npc)

      • randomObjGeneration

        private void randomObjGeneration()
        Loops through every Room object checking for its random object generation permissions. When it finds a match the appropriate generator is call.

      • coinGenerator

        private java.lang.String coinGenerator(java.util.Random r)
        Takes a random number generator. Loops through all the coin values and creates probabilities based on their value. Higher value coins have a lower probability. A random number is generated and then the normalized coin values are incremented until the running total surpasses the random number which indicates which coin should be generated.
        Parameters:
        r - Random number generator object
        Returns:
        Coin value description for the dungeon to decode.

        Parameters:

      • getRoom

        public Room getRoom(java.lang.String roomTitle)
        Get the Room object whose name is passed. This has nothing to do with where the Adventurer might be.
        Parameters:
        roomTitle - Room name
        Returns:
        room Room object from rooms hashtable keyed by room name

      • getItem

        public Item getItem(java.lang.String primaryItemName)
             throws Item.NoItemException
        Get the Item object whose primary name is passed. This has nothing to do with where the Adventurer might be, or what's in his/her inventory, etc.
        Parameters:
        primaryItemName - String - Used as key for items hashtable
        Returns:
        Item object from items hashtable
        Throws:
        Item.NoItemException

      • removeItemFromGame

        public void removeItemFromGame(Item item)
                        throws Item.NoItemException
        This is a helper method which effectively removes and Item object from the game - by removing it from the db holding Items linked to the Dungeon. Due to frequent additions of features, the items will not technically be deleted, but moved into an inaccessible(for now) db so that if a new feature is added to the game which requires bringing an Item taking out of play, but into the dungeon/game, it can be done without having to read it from a file. The idea being, when the file is originally read, and creates items, it only creates an item once.
        Parameters:
        item - target Item object which is removed from the game ie. Dungeon object db structure holding all Item objects *
        Throws:
        Item.NoItemException

      • getTeleTable

        public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,Room> getTeleTable()

      • devPrintAllItems

        public void devPrintAllItems()
        Development test method used to check game item master list by printing a list of all in-play and out-of-play items to the console.
